name: Fresh Ricotta
description: Why make homemade ricotta? Because you can. And because the results are so much better than most of the packaged stuff you can buy, especially at the supermarket. Making it yourself is also less expensive than buying fresh ricotta at a fancy gourmet market.
recipeCategory: brunch, dinner, easy, lunch, quick, condiments, dips and spreads

recipeInstructions.text: Line a colander with a quadruple layer of cheesecloth and set it over a bowl.

In a large pot over medium-high heat, whisk together all ingredients until smooth. Bring to a simmer and heat until the mixture just begins to curdle. Pour mixture into colander. (For a drier ricotta with bigger curds, continue to simmer 1 to 2 minutes longer until mixture completely separates.)
Stop draining when mixture begins to look like ricotta, 5 to 15 minutes, depending on how dry you like it. Transfer to an airtight container and store for up to two weeks.

video.description: It’s easy and economical and tastes amazing. Melissa Clark shows how to make ricotta cheese at home.
